title: Scientific Problem-Solving Competency Development Through Action Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Possession of basic science knowledge and work experience
context.additional_context: Practice-centered course applying action learning methodologies to solve real-world problems in science fields

learning_goals: Learners can analyze problems in scientific work settings using a structured framework by applying the core principles of action learning (questioning-reflection-experimentation)
Learners can form small collaborative teams, develop an action plan to solve real-world scientific work problems, and pilot it within 72 hours
Learners can write a formative assessment report evaluating implementation outcomes and proposing improvement strategies based on peer feedback
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
